text: Aspiring Air was an airline based in Wanaka, New Zealand. It operated charter pleasure flights around New Zealand's Southern Alps and scheduled services three times daily to Queenstown, connecting with Air New Zealand. Its main base was Wanaka Airport. == Code data == *IATA Code: OI ==History== The airline was established in 1974, was wholly owned by Barrie McHaffie (Managing Director) and had 8 employees == Destinations == Aspiring Air operated scheduled services between Wanaka and Queenstown (at March 2007).Flight services == Fleet == In 1986 the Aspiring Air fleet consisted of two aircraft. *1 Cessna 207 Skywagon *1 Cessna A185F Skywagon The Aspiring Air fleet consisted of the following aircraft in November 2012: *2 Britten-Norman BN2A Islander *1 Cessna 177 Cardinal *1 Cessna 172 Skyhawk ==Accidents and incidents== *On 8 August 1989, Nine passengers and the pilot died when the Britten-Norman Islander they were in crashed into terrain in the Upper Dart Valley. ==External links== *Aspiring Air ==References== Category:Defunct airlines of New Zealand Category:Airlines established in 1974 Category:Wanaka Category:1974 establishments in New Zealand
title: Aspiring Air
